quizzes.question: What is the extension for Java source code files?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The Development Cycle[/h1]

The basic development process of any Java program includes the following stages: [img id="2383" width="100%"]
[note]In Java, source code files have a [b].java[/b] extension.[/note]

quizzes.question: How are Java applications distributed?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Distribution[/h1]

After testing and fixing any existing bugs, you will be ready to [b]distribute [/b]your application to end users. 
Typically, most Java applications are distributed using a Java archive file, which has the [b].jar[/b] extension.
[note]You will learn more about the distribution process in upcoming lessons.[/note]
